sen.j: 東 常縁（とう つねより：1401年（応永8年）？ - 1484年4月11日（文明 (日本)16年3月16日 (旧暦)））は、室町時代の武将であり、歌人でもある。
sen.e: Tsuneyori TO (1401 - March 11 1484, which was March 16 according to the old calendar) was a busho (Japanese territorial lord) and Tanka poet during the Muromachi period.
Tsuneyori TO (1401 - March 11 1484, which was March 16 according to the old calendar) was a busho (Japanese territorial lord) and Tanka poet during the Muromachi period.
Tsuneyori TO (1401 - April 20, 1484) was a busho (Japanese territorial lord) and Tanka poet during the Muromachi period.
sen.cmt: 旧暦を省くグレゴリオ歴に変換

sen.e: His father was Masuyuki TO.
His father was Masuyuki TO.
His father was Masuyuki TO.
His posthumous Buddhist name was 素伝.
His posthumous Buddhist name was 素伝.
His posthumous Buddhist name was 素伝.

sen.j: 官職が下野守だったため東 野州と一般には称される。
sen.e: Tsuneyori was Shimonotsuke no kami (Provincial Governor of Shimotsuke) and he is commonly known as Yashu TO.
Tsuneyori was Shimonotsuke no kami (Provincial Governor of Shimotsuke) and he is commonly known as Yashu TO.
Tsuneyori was Shimonotsuke no kami (Provincial Governor of Shimotsuke) and he is commonly known as Yashu TO.

sen.j: 生年は1405年（応永12年）、1407年（応永14年）とも言う。
sen.e: His year of birth is still a matter of debate, some claiming it was 1405 and others claiming it was 1407.
His year of birth is still a matter of debate, some claiming it was 1405 and others claiming it was 1407.
His year of birth is still a matter of debate, some claiming it was 1405 and others claiming it was 1407.

sen.j: 東氏は千葉氏一族の武士の家柄であった。
sen.e: The To clan was in the Chiba line and a warrior family.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The To clan was in the Chiba line and a warrior family.
The To clan was in the Chiba line and a warrior family.

sen.j: 先祖の東 胤行は藤原為家の娘婿にあたり、東氏は女系ながら藤原定家の血をひく。
sen.e: His ancestor, Taneyuki TO, was a son-in-law to FUJIWARA no Tamesue, and the To clan is related by blood to FUJIWARA no Sadaie through the female line.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: His ancestor, Taneyuki TO, was a son-in-law to FUJIWARA no Tamesue, and the To clan is related by blood to FUJIWARA no Sadaie through the female line.
His ancestor, Taneyuki TO, was a son-in-law to FUJIWARA no Tamesue, and the To clan is related by blood to FUJIWARA no Sadaie through the female line.

sen.j: 室町幕府奉公衆として京都にあった。
sen.e: The To clan resided in Kyoto as hokoshu, official serving the Muromachi bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The To clan resided in Kyoto as hokoshu, officials serving the Muromachi bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun).
Tsuneyori resided in Kyoto as hokoshu, an official serving the Muromachi bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun).
sen.cmt: 主語はTsuneyori一原文一訳文の例外対処原文の文末を修正

sen.j: 冷泉派の清巌正徹にも和歌を学ぶが、1450年（宝徳2年）正式に二条派の尭孝（ぎょうこう）の門弟となる。
sen.e: Tsuneyori studied waka (31-syllable Japanese poems) from Shotetsu SEIGAN of the Reizen sect, and became an official disciple of Gyoko of the Nijo Sect in 1450.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Tsuneyori studied waka (31-syllable Japanese poems) from Shotetsu SEIGAN of the Reizen sect, and became an official disciple of Gyoko of the Nijo Sect in 1450.
Tsuneyori studied waka (31-syllable Japanese poems) from Shotetsu SEIGAN of the Reizei sect, and became an official disciple of Gyoko of the Nijo Sect in 1450.
sen.cmt: 用語修正一原文一訳文の例外対処

sen.j: 1455年（康正元年）下総国で起きた本家にあたる千葉氏の内紛を収めるため、征夷大将軍足利義政の命により、嫡流の千葉胤賢の遺児千葉実胤と千葉自胤を支援し関東を転戦した。
sen.e: In 1455, internal strife broke out in Shimotsuke Province caused by the Chiba clan, which is the head family of the To clan, and as ordered by Yoshimasa ASHIKAGA, the Barbarian subduing General, the clan supported the bereaved children of Tanekata Chiba, Sanetaka and Yoritaka, and fought in Kanto area.

In 1455, internal strife broke out in Shimotsuke Province caused by the Chiba clan, the head family of the To clan, and as ordered by Yoshimasa ASHIKAGA, the Barbarian-subduing General, the clan supported the bereaved children of Tanekata Chiba, Sanetaka and Yoritaka, and fought in the Kanto area.

In 1455, internal strife within the Chiba clan, the head family of the To clan, broke out in Shimotsuke Province, and as ordered by Yoshimasa ASHIKAGA, the Barbarian-subduing General, Tsuneyori supported the bereaved children of Tanekata Chiba, Sanetaka and Yoritaka, and fought in the Kanto area.

sen.j: だが、古河公方足利成氏が常縁に敵対的な介入を図ったために、成果は芳しくなかった。
sen.e: However, because Shigeuki ASHIKAGA, the Koga kubo, took actions against Tsuneyori, the result had not been good.
However, because Shigeuki ASHIKAGA, the Koga kubo, took actions against Tsuneyori, the result had not been good.
However, because Shigeuji ASHIKAGA, the Koga kubo, took actions against Tsuneyori, the result had not been good.

sen.j: 更に、関東滞在中に応仁の乱が発生し、所領である美濃国郡上を守護土岐成頼を擁する斎藤妙椿に奪われた。
sen.e: Furthermore, the Onin War broke out while he was in Kanto, and his land in Gujo, Mino Province, was taken over by Myochin SAITO, who supported Shigeyori TOKI, a shugo (guard).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Furthermore, the Onin War broke out while he was in Kanto, and his land in Gujo, Mino Province was taken over by Myochin SAITO, who supported Shigeyori TOKI, a shugo (guard).
Furthermore, the Onin War broke out while he was in Kanto, and his land in Gujo, Mino Province was taken over by Myochin SAITO, who supported Shigeyori TOKI, a shugo (guard).

sen.j: これを嘆いた常縁の歌により所領の返還がかなった。
sen.e: Tsuneyori's poem expressing his grief for the loss of his land resulted in the return of the land, to his possession.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Tsuneyori's poem expressing his grief for the loss of his land resulted in the return of the land to his possession.
Tsuneyori's poem expressing his grief for the loss of his land resulted in the return of the land to his possession.

sen.j: 1471年（文明3年）、宗祇に古今伝授を行っている。
sen.e: In 1471, he performed kokin denju (teach about interpretation of Kokinwakashu) to Sogi, a young poet.
sen.cmt: 宗祇が何であるか、誰であるか分からないと意味が通じないと判断し、簡単に歌人という単語を足しました。
sen.e: In 1471, he performed kokin denju (teaching about interpretation of Kokinwakashu) to Sogi, a young poet.
In 1471, he performed kokin denju (teaching about interpretation of Kokinwakashu) to Sogi, a poet.
sen.cmt: youngを省くpoetを加えたのは、翻訳者の意訳です

sen.j: 後年「拾遺愚草」の注釈を宗祇に送っている。
sen.e: In later years, he sent the explanatory note for "Shuiguso" to Sogi.
In later years, he sent an explanatory note for "Shuiguso" to Sogi.
In later years, he sent an explanatory note for "Shuiguso" to Sogi.

sen.j: 東 常縁は、古今伝授の祖として注目されるが、当時の歌壇の指導者であったわけではなく、むしろ二条派歌学の正説を伝えた歌学者としての功績が大きい。
sen.e: Tsuneyori TO is seen as the forefather of Kokin Denju; however, he did not teach poetry, but disseminated the orthodoxic teachings of the Nijo sect waka poetry.
Tsuneyori TO is seen as the forefather of Kokin Denju; however, he did not teach poetry, but disseminated the orthodox teachings of the Nijo sect waka poetry.
Tsuneyori TO is seen as the forefather of Kokin Denju; however, he did not teach poetry, but disseminated the orthodox teachings of the Nijo sect waka poetry.

sen.j: 家集には「常縁集」、歌学書には「東野州聞書」がある。
sen.e: He has two collections of waka poems, "Tsuneyorishu" and "Toyashu kikigaki."
He has two collections of waka poems, "Tsuneyorishu" and "Toyashu kikigaki."
He has two collections of waka poems, "Tsuneyorishu" and "Toyashu kikigaki."
